newsitem.title: USA: Polaroid to offer image software.
newsitem.headline: Polaroid to offer image software.

text.p: Polaroid Corp on Monday introduced its first software product - Before & After - which the Cambridge, Mass.-based company says can improve digitized pictures to photo-lab quality.
It is the first time Polaroid, which has sales of $2.3 billion worldwide, has ventured into software, Dan Richards, director of software said in a telephone interview.

The product will retail for about $30 and be sold at retail outlets and mail order. The company said it promises to significantly improve digitalized pictures with a mouse click and uses Polaroid's new IQA or Image Quality Assured technology.

"IQA will serve as the platform a new line of products," Richards said. "Before and After is our first step in software." The program works on a variety of digital cameras, printers, scanners and computer monitors.
Richards said the company was looking for IQA to be the platform for a number of software products.
"What we're really focusing on in IQA is partnering with a number of companies," Richards said. He declined to name any "because we don't have any formal agreements in place."
